page.title: 07VOLUME OF TRAFFIC
page.content: The A.20 connecting Ashford and Maidstone is a very important route from the coast and as a result the volume of traffic has steadily increased over the years. While this is unavoidable it has brought problems to villages along its route. Harrietsham is divided into east and west areas as a result which makes difficulties for people wanting to cross the road. In recent years a pedestrian crossing with traffic lights has been installed at the eastern end of the village near "The Roebuck" restaurant. Perhaps the most notable change is the growth in size of heavy lorries. This has an unexpected result in that since many are too big to pass beneath the railway bridge they have to use side roads, causing difficulties there.
